subject: Re: [junit] Re: Starting with
msgSnippet: Dave, you have to start citing MY article for beginners... support your local Canadian, even if he s from Toronto. :) So said  Dave Astels
messageBody:
Dave, you have to start citing MY article for beginners... support your
local Canadian, even if he's from Toronto. :)

So said Dave Astels <dave@...> on 2003-01-23
--------------------

>--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Sajeesh.S <krssajeesh2000@y...>"
><krssajeesh2000@y...> wrote:
>> Hello all,
>>
>> Can i get a good document or tutorial on how to start with this
>Junit
>> testing?? Iam just a beginner..
>
>http://junit.sourceforge.net/#Documentation
>
>http://www.thecoadletter.com/backissues/?sort_type=type#a6
>(read the Test-driven Development issues)
>
>http://www.amazon.com/exec/obidos/ASIN/0321146530
>
>www.clarkeware.com and look for the JUnit Primer & FAQ.
>
>Then *ahem* watch for my "Test-driven Development: A Practical Guide"
>which is focused on JUnit. It should be out this spring.
>
>If you have the money, take a course. Several folks offer them,
>including us (www.saorsa.com)
>
>Dave
>
>
